---
title: "Auto-Generation"
description: "How auto-generated entries work and when to use them."
navLabel: "Auto-Generation"
navIcon: "âš¡"
draft: false
---

**Auto-generation** automatically discovers and includes all markdown files in a folder without manually listing each one.

## Manual vs Auto-Generated

### Manual (Explicit)

List every entry:

```typescript
{
  id: 'guides',
  label: 'Guides',
  entries: [
    { slug: 'guides/installation' },
    { slug: 'guides/configuration' },
    { slug: 'guides/advanced' }
  ]
}
```

**Pros:**
- Full control over order
- Can customize each entry
- Predictable

**Cons:**
- Must update config when adding files
- More maintenance

### Auto-Generated

Let the system discover files:

```typescript
{
  id: 'guides',
  label: 'Guides',
  autoGenerated: true
}
```

**Pros:**
- Add files, they appear automatically
- Less config maintenance
- Great for growing docs

**Cons:**
- Alphabetical order (hard to customize)
- Less control per entry
- Can become messy with many files

## How Auto-Generation Works

### Step 1: Folder Structure

Files under `content/docs/guides/`:

```sh
content/docs/guides/
â”œâ”€ advanced.md
â”œâ”€ configuration.md
â”œâ”€ installation.md
â””â”€ troubleshooting.md
```

### Step 2: Configuration

```typescript
{
  id: 'guides',
  label: 'Guides',
  autoGenerated: true
}
```

### Step 3: Result

Files are discovered and sorted **alphabetically**:

```sh
Guides
â”œâ”€ Advanced
â”œâ”€ Configuration
â”œâ”€ Installation
â””â”€ Troubleshooting
```

The `title` from each file's frontmatter becomes the sidebar label.

## Alphabetical Ordering

Auto-generated entries are sorted A-Z by their title (or filename if no title).

```sh
content/docs/guides/
â”œâ”€ zebra-guide.md       â†’ "Zebra Guide"
â”œâ”€ apple-guide.md       â†’ "Apple Guide"
â””â”€ banana-guide.md      â†’ "Banana Guide"

Result (alphabetical):
â”œâ”€ Apple Guide
â”œâ”€ Banana Guide
â””â”€ Zebra Guide
```

To control order, use **numeric prefixes**:

```sh
content/docs/guides/
â”œâ”€ 1-apple-guide.md     â†’ "Apple Guide"
â”œâ”€ 2-banana-guide.md    â†’ "Banana Guide"
â””â”€ 3-zebra-guide.md     â†’ "Zebra Guide"
```

Or use the file path in the frontmatter's `navLabel`.

## Mixed Manual and Auto-Generated

Combine both approaches:

```typescript
{
  id: 'guides',
  label: 'Guides',
  autoGenerated: true,
  entries: [
    { slug: 'guides/getting-started', icon: 'ğŸš€' },  // Manual: appears first
    { slug: 'guides/installation' }                   // Manual: appears second
    // Auto-generated entries follow alphabetically
  ]
}
```

**Result:**
```sh
Guides
â”œâ”€ ğŸš€ Getting Started    (manual)
â”œâ”€ Installation          (manual)
â”œâ”€ Advanced             (auto)
â”œâ”€ Configuration        (auto)
â””â”€ Troubleshooting      (auto)
```

**Order:**
1. Manual entries (in your specified order)
2. Auto-generated entries (alphabetically)

## Nested Auto-Generation

Auto-generate groups inside a group:

```typescript
{
  id: 'documentation',
  label: 'Documentation',
  groups: [
    {
      id: 'guides',
      label: 'Guides',
      autoGenerated: true,
      path: 'guides'  // Optional: specifies which subfolder
    },
    {
      id: 'reference',
      label: 'Reference',
      autoGenerated: true,
      path: 'reference'
    }
  ]
}
```

The `path` field specifies the subfolder to auto-generate from.

## When Files Are Not Included

Auto-generated entries skip:

1. **Draft files** - Files with `draft: true` in frontmatter
2. **Hidden entries** - Files with `navHidden: true` in frontmatter
3. **Nested folders** - Only direct children are included (use nested groups for subfolders)

```yaml
---
title: "Draft Guide"
draft: true  # â† Won't appear in sidebar
---
```

```yaml
---
title: "Internal Page"
navHidden: true  # â† Hidden from sidebar (but URL still works)
---
```

## Controlling Auto-Generation Folder

Use `path` to specify which folder to auto-generate from:

```typescript
{
  id: 'guides',
  label: 'Guides',
  autoGenerated: true,
  path: 'guides'  // Only auto-generates from content/docs/guides/
}
```

Without `path`, it infers from the folder name or requires manual specification.

## Real-World Example

A documentation site that grows over time:

**Initial structure:**
```typescript
{
  id: 'guides',
  label: 'Guides',
  autoGenerated: true
}
```

**Files:**
```sh
content/docs/guides/
â”œâ”€ 1-getting-started.md
â”œâ”€ 2-installation.md
â””â”€ 3-configuration.md
```

**Later, you add more files:**
```sh
content/docs/guides/
â”œâ”€ 1-getting-started.md
â”œâ”€ 2-installation.md
â”œâ”€ 3-configuration.md
â”œâ”€ 4-advanced-setup.md    â† New
â”œâ”€ 5-troubleshooting.md   â† New
â””â”€ 6-faq.md               â† New
```

**The sidebar updates automatically** - no config changes needed!

## Tips & Best Practices

- âœ… **Use auto-generation for growing docs** - Less maintenance
- âœ… **Use numeric prefixes for ordering** - `1-`, `2-`, `3-` work great
- âœ… **Use meaningful file names** - They become sidebar labels
- âœ… **Use `navLabel` to override display names** - Short labels in sidebar
- âœ… **Mix manual and auto for featured pages** - Pin important pages
- âŒ **Don't rely on alphabetical order** - Use numeric prefixes instead
- âŒ **Don't auto-generate if you need exact control** - Use manual instead
- âŒ **Don't nest auto-generated folders too deep** - Becomes confusing
